name: More Best Stars, Best Movies Quiz | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Alan Ladd's best movie was definitely "Shane". Van Heflin did a great job in a supporting role as the farmer. Who played Heflin's wife?
questions.explanation:
Jean Arthur.

	Her last role - and a good one. With Jack Palance, Ben Johnson and the unlucky Brandon de Wilde as the little boy. One of the best westerns ever (if not the best.)

questions.text: The best movie made by Burt Reynolds (and also by Jon Voight) is "Deliverance". The author had a small role in the movie as a sheriff. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
James Dickey.

	Good, solid adventure story.

questions.text: Edmond O'Brien may be best known for his supporting roles, but he also made movies in which he starred. His best movie was "D.O.A.". What was his character's problem in that movie?
options: His wife had hired someone to kill him
He'd been framed for a crime
questions.explanation:
He'd been poisoned.

	"Dead on Arrival". What happened? How? Why? Who did it?

questions.text: Dana Andrews starred in the fine "Best Years of Our Lives". Who played his less-than-wonderful wife?
questions.explanation:
Virginia Mayo.

	He ends up with Teresa Wright. Well-done.

questions.text: Robert Taylor's best movie was "Ivanhoe". Who played Elizabeth Taylor's (successful) romantic rival for his affections?
questions.explanation:
Joan Fontaine.

	Rousing stuff. The fair blonde and the dark-haired "other woman".

questions.text: Jason Robards was one of the stars of "All The President's Men". Who did he play?
questions.explanation:
Newspaperman.

	He played Ben Bradlee, head honcho at the Washington Post. Extremely well-made movie - all the more interesting because it's non-fiction.

questions.text: Warren Beatty starred in the easygoing "Heaven Can Wait". Who was NOT in the cast?
questions.explanation:
Donald Sutherland.

	Christie was the right woman for him, but he was married (in his new life) to Cannon (who was scheming with Grodin). Much better than the original version.

questions.text: Dustin Hoffman's "breakthrough" movie turned out to be a small classic. How does he escape with Katharine Ross in "The Graduate"?
questions.explanation:
By bus.

	Great image of Hoffman in a windbreaker and Ross in full bridal attire running from the church and jumping on a bus. "Mrs. Robinson" (Anne Bancroft in the movie) was immortalized by Paul Simon in his song.

questions.text: Fred MacMurray didn't do a lot of film noir, but "Double Indemnity" was quite good. Do the "bad guys" - Macmurray and Stanwyck - get away with it?
questions.explanation:
no.

	Unusual roles for both stars.

questions.text: William Holden starred in "Stalag 17". Where was the prisoner that he helped to escape hiding?
questions.explanation:
Water Tank.

	Fine, gritty movie with a good "tough guy" performance by Holden.
